thread.title: Keira Knightley's Broadway debut interrupted by man, flowers
thread.title_full: Keira Knightley's Broadway debut interrupted by man, flowers - Yahoo News

author: MARK KENNEDY
title: Keira Knightley's Broadway debut interrupted by man, flowers
text:
NEW YORK (AP) — Keira Knightley's Broadway debut was interrupted when a member of the audience shouted at the actress and threw a bouquet of flowers at the stage before being escorted from the theater.
Knightley, who plays the title character in the play "Therese Raquin" was onstage Thursday with Gabriel Ebert when the disturbance took place at the Studio 54 Theatre, the same location where last year actor Shia LaBeouf was handcuffed during a performance of "Cabaret" for yelling obscenities.
Jessica Johnson, who represents the Roundabout Theatre Company, says the safety of actors and audiences is taken very seriously and extra security would be added starting Friday.
Performing Arts Humanities Keira Knightley bouquet of flowers Gabriel Ebert
